abstract: Cisco isn’t afraid to make surprising deals — even big ones. In March, it announced a $3.2 billion acquisition of WebEx, causing several pundits to wonder why the company, which makes networking gear, would buy a videoconferencing firm. That deal came just after the much smaller acquisition of Tribe.net, a social-networking Web site that had long been eclipsed by MySpace, Facebook, and others.
lead_paragraph: Cisco isn’t afraid to make surprising deals — even big ones. That deal came just after the much smaller acquisition of Tribe.net, a social-networking Web site that had long been eclipsed by MySpace, Facebook, and others.
